ygData.subject: URI always a URL?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi,    The resources I have always dealt with have started with http:// i.e. they are URLs. I know a URN can identify things without providing a location

Hi,
=A0=A0 The resources I have always dealt with have started with "http:/=
/" i.e. they are URLs. I know a URN can identify "things" without providing=
 a location or means for accessing that "thing", but how can you interact w=
ith that resource unless you know its location/access method (the URL) ?

I=
n short, why don't we use the more specific term (i.e. URL) when referring =
to RESTful
HTTP? Or when we use the term URI are we implicitly using URL?

=
Thanks,
Sean./



      
--0-1547205076-1278668548=:70458
